main event: Two reports received regarding a visual sighting of an unidentified object in the North Pacific.
interesting points: The observation involved ground-visual, ground-radar, and air intercept radar methods., The sighting lasted for about 5 minutes., Reports suggested that what was seen might only be flares., The conclusions included possibilities of it being a balloon or satellites., The object was detected at coordinates 47N 173W.
sighted object: an unidentified object possibly resembling flares
witness description: based on reports from radar and visual observations
